description: Construction of a second-floor level and part third floor level; along with associated internal alterations and external alterations to the building facade to facilitate the creation of 7 self-contained flats across the first, second and third floor levels; and the provision of associated refuse storage; cycle storage and communal roof garden.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.
| The materials and finishes to the external surfaces of the development shall be in accordance with the plans listed in condition 2 and in accordance with the application form.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1 and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan 2021 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| Except as where indicated within the approved plans no part of the roof shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D5 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| The refuse and recycling storage facilities hereby approved as shown on plan A-52-001 Rev 1 shall be kept locked, and implemented and operational before the first occupation of any part of the development, and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to first occupation of the residential units hereby approved screening to all proposed balconies, terraces and private amenity areas shall be installed as indicated on the approved drawings and an obscured glass screen 1.7m high shall be installed to the communal terrace at roof level. This screening shall be fully implemented and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with Policies 7A, 7.4, and 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies D5 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| The cycle parking facilities hereby approved as shown on plan A-52-001 Rev 1 shall be implemented and operational before the first use of any part of the development hereby approved, and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. A minimum of 12 adult and 2 child cycle parking spaces shall be provided and located in a secure undercover and lockable compound.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications and external amenity areas shall be in accordance with the Council's assessment standards of the SPG10, noise measurements to be made outside any public lockdown restrictions, school or public holidays, achieving compliance with the acoustic noise limits specified in BS8233:2014.  If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self-noise).  The above shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different uses in adjoining dwellings and communal and commercial uses from dwellings shall be implemented in accordance with the recommendation made by Noise.Co.Uk in their report ref. 20137- 1 R1, dated 8 October 2019. Mitigation measures shall achieve the enhanced sound insulation levels and be in accordance with the noise limits specified in SPG10 and BS 8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration', Standard 30 of the Housing SPG and Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021).

| The external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 5dBA as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises in order to prevent any adverse impact. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| Prior to occupation of the residential units hereby approved, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| All boilers to serve the energy requirements of the development, including space heating and hot water to the flats, shall use Ultra-low NOx boilers with maximum NOx Emissions of under 0.030 g/kWh and be compliant with the NOx (g/m²) benchmarks as set out at Appendix 5 of the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. Such boilers shall be installed prior to first occupation of the development and thereafter shall be permanently retained.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough; and policies SI 1 and SI 2 of the London Plan (2021).
